channel.title: Decoding the login block via Ruby
channel.description: Have been messing around with the JRuby library for a little bit on a basic framework and was thinking about handling the login deciphering via ruby scripts for each state of the block? Any thoughts on this? Good idea? Bad idea?

item.title: Decoding the login block via Ruby
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

ye. however I have scripted configurations involving how to dynamically decode packets so theres that. not exactly I/O tho

Read full topic
item.source: Decoding the login block via Ruby

item.title: Decoding the login block via Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:2, topic:550775”]Probably dont want to do this in scripting, its not dynamic enough.

array.pack, array.unpack[/quote]

So would it be better to just avoid using scripting for anything handling IO operations?

Read full topic
